intro: Dolichos oliveri var. vondensis, commonly known as the Vondens wild bean, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features include hairy stems and yellow flowers, which contribute to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
